values: Alright, I've put a moderate amount of thought into these, and along with some unedcuated guesses, I think I have some pretty strong predicts here. Oh, and having only seen three of the five movies nominated for best picture, they might be a bit of a shot in the dark. Fuck it. Best Supporting Actress Jennifer Hudson, Dreamgirls - CORRECT! now it just remains to be seen if she can actually act or just sings on screen with some conviction. Time will tell! Who would I have picked? Adriana Barazza, Babel Best Supporting Actor Eddie Murphy, Dreamgirls - WRONG! Good, too, I say since he stormed off like a little bitch after not winningWho would I have picked? Having seen all of the films except Little Children, I have to say they seem to be some weak choices.. I'd give it to Murphy (even though he wasn't that good) if it means never hearing a trailer proclaim "Starring Eddie Murphy, Eddie Murphy, Eddie Murphy, and.......Eddie Murphy.." again. Best Actress Helen Mirren, The Queen CORRECT! Who would I have picked? Well, I just realized I haven't seen a single one of these movies. Lets go with Kate Winslet. She's pretty good. Best Actor Forest Whitaker, The Last King of Scotland CORRECT! Who would I have picked? ONLY because I haven't yet seen Last King of Scotland (plan on seeing it later today), I'll go with Ryan Gosling. He was absolutely incredible in Half Nelson. Best Director Martin Scorcese, The Departed CORRECT! Who would I have picked? Out of the nominees, I'd choose Scorcese. That being said, I think Guillemero Del Toro should have been nominated and ultimately won the award. Pan's Labyrinth was so original, poignant and beautiful. The Departed is still my favourite movie of 2006, but I think if Scorcese is finally recognized, it won't be solely on the strength of his latest crime masterpiece, but to make up for snubbing him with Mean Streets, Taxi Driver, Raging Bull, and Goodfellas. So while I think Scorcese has been robbed, and I won't be disappointed in the least if he wins, he wasn't the absolute best. It is a shame that Del Toro and also Alfonso Cuaron (Children of Men) weren't nominated. Best PictureBabel WRONG! Pleasant surprise though, considering.. Who would I have picked? The Departed.

As if there weren't enough amazing albums in 2006, I've recently got my hands on a couple that unfortunately I didn't hear in time, but I'll be damned if it was from lack of trying. OK, it was 100% lack of effort on my part. So sue me. The records (or "rekkids", if you're a douchebag)in question are Off With Their Heads' brilliant 8-song EPHospitals and Crime in Stereo's sophomore full-length The Troubled Stateside. I just can't stop listening to these fuckin' things! OWTH take lyrics so depressing that after a few listens, your vain, disparate "life", which consists of waking up and watching a Rosanne DVD marathon while drinking whatever was on sale at the liquor store out of a pint glass and then masturbating using your own tears as lubricant until you pass out in a puddle of your own various bodily fluids, seems pretty good in comparison. And it's catchy as hell! The Troubled Stateside, while not as suicide-inducing as OWTH's latest, is still pretty fucking good. Its fast, hard, and melodic, which, if you know me at all, are the three keys to my musical heart. I've heard them being compared to labelmates No Trigger and A Wilhelm Scream, but they definitely have a more original sound. If you need some proof, just go listen to Sudan. It might just be my favourite song. Of the week. That or Die Today by Off With Their Heads. Totally unrelated, me and The Boyz (copyright and trademark) went to Ryerson's "Night of 9500 Laughs" on Saturday night. While the name was deceiving (I only laughed about 6 times through the first 8 performers) local hero Jeff McEnery made it worthwhile with a hilarious set. I really need to work on some jokes and try out an act at some open mic or something. I mean, I don't want to toot my own horn (or do I?[the answer is yes]) I really don't think I could do any worst than all but maybe one or two of the so-called comedians that performed Saturday. Particularly the guy with the toque. "Remember the first time you ate a pussy? Yeaaahh. I'm drunk. But yeah remember that clitoris? I'm just going to call it the clit, cause clitoris sounds weird. Remember that shit?" What was up with that guy? Seriously! Oh, and unrelated to that, but somewhat related to the beginning of this post: really excited for I Farm. Should be tight. And Smokin' Aces too. WOOOOOO

Hey all! Good news! Apparently Mandy was looking through the dictionary again, and decided there weren't enough words (again) so she's gone and invented one! Horrocious! I think it's some kind of ungodly combination of horrible and atrocious, but really, who the hell knows? In other news, our little reporter in the field has proven that contrary to previous reports, pimpin' IS easy!
Oh yeah, hope everyone had a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year's.  All the best in '07 to everyone who reads this.  Anyone that doesn't, fuck you.
Yes, I have a scantily clad ninja girl tattooed on my arm. And yes, Mandy LOVES it. Check back later this week for my Top 10 CD's of 2006 and Top 5 Movies

Introducing/unleashing Owen Joseph Beattie-Clarke to y'all. He was born Thrusday, August 17th at Guelph General Hospital at about 8:23 AM. Weighing in at 4lbs, 6oz and measuring about 18 inches long, he's now up to 5lbs 4oz and 21 inches. He's my son and the pride of Mandy and myself. There's nothing like the feeling you get everytime he does something he's never done before. Its going to be an adventure and I couldn't look forward to it more. In other news, my softball team, The Bombers, are rollin' on like a freight train. We won our first playoff game this past Wednesday (16-6) after finishing the season in second place with a record of 13 wins, 4 losses, and 1 tie. The first place team, Josh's Pub, went undefeated during the regular season, but both times we played them were very close games and we think we can take them if and when we make it to the finals. You can count on the Bomb Squad. This is pretty old news, but here's proof that I am, in fact, a good guy. There's some stiff competition for the ol' Top 10 of the year for music, with a plethora of bands releasing albums ranging from great to amazing. Alphabetically, just so you don't think I'm listing them in the order of bestness, these bands all deserve a big pat on the back for "bringing the thunder" so far this year: Another Breath, Armalite, Bigwig (yeah, it grew on me), Bomb the Music Industry, The Bouncing Souls, The Falcon, I Farm, The Lawrence Arms, The Loved Ones, New Mexican Disaster Squad, No Trigger, Nofx, None More Black, Retrace (breaking in with a great demo), Rise Against (with a nice return to form after the disappointing Siren Songs), The Sainte Catherines, Set Your Goals, Sinking Ships, and Strike Anywhere. Plus there are still releases from the likes of Fifth Hour Hero and Shook Ones, amongst others. Oh, and Propagandhi actually playing shows! I can not motherfucking wait! Speaking of things to look forward to, I really want to see the following movies: The Illusionist, Babel, Children of Men, The Departed, The Protector, Rennaisance, The Fountain, and The Prestige.

we got in, the first band sucked so we talked to some people from ohio, who ended up being pretty cool, then lawrence arms and alkaline trio rocked for a couple hours then we headed back to georgetown with ohioans in tow, and hung out then they stayed over then left THE END!

Nothing could have prepared us for the events that transpired that fateful Friday night in Toronto. It was a cool May night and the forecast was calling for rain. We were making our way down the Queen's Quay, the twangy guitars and raspy vocals coming from the speakers on the dash interspersed by patchwork conversation and miscellaneous quips from the three of us in that old Contour, oblivious to the concatenation of events that would soon turn our worlds upside-down, and leave us reeling in the aftermath. No, none of us have been the same since that night. I sometimes reminisce, which usually results in me trying to determine whether it was me who had changed, or indeed the world that had changed around me. We couldn't find a parking spot in the deep bowels of the underground parking lot for a fortress-sized grocery store. It was a good thing that traffic had been light on the way there. We slowly rolled past bumper after bumper, each one surrounded by concrete pillars, peering left and right, scanning the subterranean profile. Then the kicker came. A sign crudely bolted to one of the massive pillars proved our hopes were futile. A three hour parking limit shattered any remaining optimism for finding a free parking spot. It was clear we were going to have to find a spot closer to the concert and pay for parking. If this had been the most shocking thing of the night, we would have all counted ourselves lucky. TO BE CONTINUED....yeah I'm a jerk

Is it too early in the season to start making predictions?  The Coldtech Bombers are undefeated with two wins and a tie, after winning tonight's game 10-6.  Can anyone stop this slo-pitch juggernaut?  Time will tell, but if I had to wager a guess, I'd say this powerhouse team will steamroll over their "competition" all season. 

What do you get when you take 3 nights, 5 Satanists, 6 Alcoholics from Chicago, 3 Lovers from Philly, and 4 Random Ohioans?  Full story later this week!  Stay tuned!

Well, this is going to be one crazy, busy week. Tuesday we try to keep our undefeated record in tact in the highly competitive Slow-pitch softball league. That's right, I joined a team. We're called the Coldtech Bombers and so far we've played two games. We won our first game (24-4) and tied the second (11's all around). It feels good to be playing baseball again, even if it is a stripped-down, bastardized version of baseball meant for middle-aged drunks. It is fun though, and that's the main thing. I've got two shows to look forward to this week, one on Wednesday and the other on Friday. First off, it's the 2006 edition of the Grind tour, featuring Canadian ska stalwarts Subb, Swedish skate-punk veterans Satanic Surfers (who neither surf nor practice any form of Satanism), and a couple of Fat bands, the lovable Loved Ones, and headliners Mad Caddies. Friday then brings to town two of my favourite bands that I've never seen: Alkaline Trio and The Lawrence Arms. I'm extremely excited to see both bands, and don't be too surprised if I don't have much of a voice come Saturday morning. Thursday brings round two of our pre-natal class. I was thrilled and shortly after disappointed when while in the first class, noticed a guy with an uncanny resemblance to Simon Pegg (best known as the titular character from Shaun of the Dead). Unfortunately, the guy's name turned out to be Devon. No accent, either. The nerve of some people, I tell ya. All that plus I don't even know what I'm going to do for the long weekend! Maybe I'll just take it easy and see if I can wrangle up the second season of Curb Your Enthusiasm on DVD. Larry David is my new idol. I hope that when I'm old that I can be half as bitter and successful as him.
I haven't posted any pictures in a while. Here ya go. I DARE you to find a worse tasting beverage with a cooler design on the can. I double-dare you, motherfucker.

Clifford Joseph Glaude.  I'll miss him so much, but I'm glad that he's at peace now.  Its comforting knowing that most of the family has inherited his sense of humor, story-telling skills, and most of all his unlimited love.  Rest in peace, Grandpa.



now, on a less serious/sentimental note: 

-I got some Hires root beer today.  Didn't know the stuff still existed.  Evidently it does.  

-1 Year+ and it feels great.  I love you so much Mandy

-Bomb the Music Industry!, and in particular the song 'Syke! Life is Awesome!' make me smile a lot
 
-Speaking of the music industry, i think 2006 is the year of Fat.  They've already put out releases ranging from very solid to amazing (The Loved Ones, The Sainte Catherines, The Lawrence Arms), have None More Black's sophomore full-length This is Satire coming out next week (which is also fuckin' rocking) and still have releases from Strike Anywhere, Smoke or Fire, and a live album from Against Me! to look forward to.  Top 3 so far: Lawrence Arms - Oh Calcutta, Armalite, and None More Black - This is Satire

-Arrested Development is the best TV show of all time, ever

-Montreal is goin' all the way.  Oh, and fuck the leafs. HA!

Holy god damn SHIT it's been a while, hasn't it?

I think the reason I haven't written anything in so long is because I didn't know how to properly put into words the one major thing that's been on my mind for the last 3 months and a bit.  That, of course, would be the fact that Mandy is having a baby and that I'm going to be a Dad.  

Whoa.  Talk about your world-turner-upside-downers.  I've gone through (and go through pretty much every day) a range of feelings ranging from suffocating fear and panic to reckless excitement.  I mean, I'm sure that's normal for people about to have a baby.  It's just not normal for me.  I never imagined being in this situation at this point in my life.  A year ago, the biggest things on my mind were that I was starting to hang out with Mandy again and Sin City.  Now, I'm trying to find a place for me, Mandy, and my impending bundle of joy (I hate that expression) to live before my current landlords kick me out, all the while trying to keep her family happy, my family happy, my boss happy, and my friends happy.  Sanity delicately teeters on the brink of extinction.  

I don't mean for this to come off as negative.  I really am looking forward to this and get excited thinking about it a lot.  I love Mandy and I will love the baby and I'll do everything I can to make us a happy family. 

Anyway, so that's the condensed version of why I haven't been updating.  I just felt stupid writing meaningless shit when I knew I should have been writing about what was really on my mind 99% of the time.  I just wasn't sure how to go about it, and I'm still not even after writing this, but I'll be damned If I'm going to delete it now.  So forgive the jumbled thoughts of this tired madman, and maybe now I can get back to talking about movies and music.

Speaking of which, Paint it Black was crazy.  What a night, what a night.  Aside from being one of, if not THE, most intense band I've ever seen, I got to actually talk to all the guys in the band, which was totally fucking cool.  I'm not really the type to get star-struck or gush about people in bands, but for christ's sake, Dan Yemin!  The guy's resume speaks for itself.  He's been in consistently amazing bands since before I had any clue what 'punk rock' was.  Not that I do now, but who the hell cares anyway?  ANYWAY, so I'm standing there shooting the shit with the good Doctor, and man, the guy is just completely cool.  Way more level-headed than he has any business being, boasting that kind of track record, but I'll take it.  Oh yeah, I'm really starting to dig the Armalite album, too.  The man can do no wrong.  It's just really good, grown-up pop punk from some dudes who love making music, and I fuckin' can't get enough of it.  I'm starting to think I really missed out on something with Atom and His Package and need to rectify that.  

Anyway, I guess this will do.  See ya in June!  (just kidding)...maybe..

Round Hips Sink Ships!

And Happy Birthday Mom! You don't look a day over 50.  I bet you will tomorrow, though.  Exactly one day over 50.

Lawrence Arms' Oh! Calcutta! is the early choice for best record of the year. There should be some stiff competition though (None More Black, I'm looking in your direction.) In unrelated news, we went to see some apartments tonight.. garbage! Its so hard to find a decent place to live here without it costing both arms, legs, ears, eyes, and genatalia. And that doesn't cover utilities either! Anyway, there's another place that we're going to check out on Friday that sounds a lot more promising. Keep your fingers crossed!

"what's an android?"
"remember in Alien when Bilbo Baggins starts shooting milk everywhere, then blows up?  That's an android"
Production on the as of yet unnamed project from Hit on the Temple to commence... TODAY!

I think I've been fired for the first time. Indefinitely laid off I guess is the official word around the office. I'm not sure how I feel about it. On one hand, I'm obviously worried about how I'm going to pay my bills and rent and all that stuff. On the other hand, I wish I just had the money right now to pay off my debts, say fuck it to this apartment and that stupid fucking loud ass dog upstairs, and.... I don't know.. retire.. be like Caine and walk the Earth. Start a travelling comedy troupe and entertain crowds all across the continent or something. I'm just at a point where I desperately need to figure out what it is I want to do instead of biding my time doing things that make me unhappy. I mean, I shouldn't complain I have an amazing girlfriend and awesome friends and (for the most part) an incredible family. There's just something missing and I don't think I'm going to find it in someone's basement while I'm connecting cables or in a factory or warehouse. I feel like I need to do something soon before it's too late and I wake up one day and I realize I missed my shot to do something special. Oh, and Chris, I guess this is.. a long time coming.. and I'm sorry for my lax in sensitivity when it comes to your unrelenting vanity, which knows no bounds. So, here you go.

Here's a scenario:  You're driving home in rush hour traffic on a main 2 lane road, and it is very backed up and slow.  There is a set of lights and right after the set of lights, the lanes merge and the road becomes 1 lane.  Knowing well in advance that the road merges and that traffic is backed up, you decide, to hell with everyone, I'm going to drive up as far as I can until the lane merges and then try to cut into the non-moving traffic in the other lane.  Do not expect me to let you in.  In fact, I'm going to do everything I can to make sure you're stuck in the ever-narrowing merging lane as long as possible.  After you realize this, you decide to get a tiny bit ahead of me and just start veering into my lane.  

Also, it's Friday after a long day of work.  I want to fucking kill that person.

On a somewhat unrelated note, the latest odds of me dying in my work van are 3:1.  I've put my money down, what are you waiting for?  And if I do..............

I want my epitaph to read "He called it"

I'm twenty-two, don't know what I'm supposed to do Thanks to everyone that came out or wished me a happy birthday for making this past weekend one for the history books. If you think pictures say 1000 (or more) words, get ready for a novel below. PS who's got an extra microwave they want to donate? PPS Do Lunch is cancelled... hopefully to be resurrected in the future sometime

Wow, what an awesome weekend. Friday night we celebrated Andy's birthday in style, shitfaced at Molly Bloom's with Andy eventually throwing up in the loo and us getting kicked out a little after 1 am. I got home and in bed. Fast-forward to Saturday morning, I notice Mandy beside me and half-remember her calling and coming over some time after I'd passed out. Sweet deal. Then the time comes and we go over to 'Pleasures of the Flesh' around noon for my tattoo appointment. Ok, if you're going to get a tattoo, I do not recommend any of the following things: - heavy drinking the night before - not eating anything in the time between the heavy drinking and the tattoo Actually, I guess you should only pay attention to the second one, because I'm sure some food would have made the whole stomach full of nothing but alcohol thing go away. Also, the rumors are true.. the back of the arm is considerably more painfulto get tattooed than right on the bicep. Oh well, it wasn't that bad, and only lasts for a while. So Saturday night comes along and we all get dressed up..Mandy as Cruella Deville, Steve as Bo Duke, Andy as a soccer hooligan/guy who got dragged out at the last minute/Captain England, and head to the Dirty Denim. We meet up with Chris and Laura there. Chris' costume was part of a sweet collaborative effort to do a (I think) porno version of Alice in Wonderland. Congratulations to them for winning best group costume. The Flintstones and Mario Kart groups were pretty awesome as well. Also the Mariachi Band who made me an honourary member but got screwed in the voting. I have to say though, the guy dressed as Ash (see: Evil Dead, Army of Darkness) had the most boss costume ever. Chainsaw hand and all. I didn't get a picture of him, but here's one of Ash, just because he's so tough. Aaaaand here's one of us for good measure.

I just received the following e-mail from my Nana. I stopped reading after the second sentence, which I found very discouraging. Go ahead and check it out. Subject: God Told me to tell me to tell you. GOD TOLD ME TO TELL YOU...... It shall be well with you this year. No matter how much your enemies try this year, they will not succeed. You have been destined to make it and you shall surely achieve all your goals this year. For the remaining months of the year, your problems will enter Call blocking, your enemies will have network problems and their bad wishes for you will enter into voicemail and you will only get them as missed calls. All your agonies will be diverted and victory and prosperity will be your incoming calls! Heavens have confirmed today the end of your sufferings sorrows and pains because HE that sits on the throne has remembered you. He has taken away the hardships and given you JOY. He will never let you down. I knocked at heavens door this morning, God asked me... My child! what can I do for you? And I said, Father, please protect and bless the person reading this message... God smiled and answered... Request granted. If you believe, send it to seven people and the one who sent it to you. By doing this you have succeeded in praying for eight people today. Have a Blessed Day!! ------------------------------------------------ Ok, what? I have enemies? And they're trying hard to prevent me from succeeding!? First of all, I don't know who these enemies are. Second of all, if any of those enemies are reading this, what did I ever do to you? Third of all, if you are my enemy, you've lost the element of surprise so you'd better watch out.
Hoo-ah! P.S. The new Propagandhi album fucking KILLS and i'm only on track 6.

Alright, a few orders of business here, presented in bullet form for your convenience. Some of this isn't really 'news' because I haven't updated it in a while. I guess you could call it olds. Or, you know, you could not do that. - My new TV rocks, and my living room is awesome now. Don't believe me? I knew you wouldn't, because you never do so I took this picture to prove it. - The play Andrew and I wrote, "Do Lunch", is actually happening. It's going to be a part of the Georgetown Little Theatre youth one act play festival, so everyone book off December 1-3 so you can come see it all three nights. It'll be worth it, because there will be muchos improv, assuring a different experience every time! That's our pitch! Also it's really funny, so if you don't come you're a fucking humorless asshole. - Strung Out fucking rocked. They played pretty much everything I wanted to hear, save for 'mephisto'. All the classics were covered though.. we got 'Exhumation of Virginia Madison', 'Ultimate Devotion', 'Firecracker', and closed with 'Matchbook' before coming back and playing 'Too Close To See' and a couple other tunes for an encore. The new songs sounded great too, especially 'Analog' (which they opened with) and 'Her Name in Blood'. It was seriously one of the best shows I've EVER been to (seems I say that a lot, but seriously..) Comeback Kid were solid as always, even with the guitarist filling in for vocal duties, and Bane was better than when I saw them earlier in the year (which also happened to be with CBK.) They played 'Both Guns Blazing', which is probably their best song and it was pretty awesome. Strung Out definitely owned the place though. Awesome show. - Yeah that's it for now. One Love.

He Laughed, He Loved, He Got Shot to Death Trying to Commandeer a Russian Submarine While Intoxicated And actually, I'd really like it if the words "international incident" were used prominently and abundantly in my eulogy.

After much deliberation, I've come to the conclusion that working eleven and a half to twelve hours a day, and getting paid for eight is much worse than working for five to seven hours and getting paid for between eight and ten hours. Much, much worse. That's not even taking into consideration the fact that I don't get to sleep in any more. This is lame. Oh well at least I had a good weekend to counter the sudden surge in the suck factor at work. Had fun at April's new crib on Friday. Here's a postcard from the sexy party: Saturday was fun too.. we saw Laura lose her consolation game for softball but it was OK because we got to heckle Elena and the umpire (BOCK!). Also, Andy made the king of "that's what she said" jokes. After that we got together at my place and enjoyed some refreshing beverages while taking in some Ong Bak (which, by the way, is 100 times funnier dubbed) before going to Shoeless Joe's and being treated to round after round of shots courtesy of Robbie. Props to him for buying me lots of alcohol, and for throwing a cool little BBQ on Sunday. Sunday night was amazing too. There are just those special nights where nothing really extraordinary happens, but all the little things add up to make the evening as a whole extraordinary, and that's what Sunday was for me.
to B.C. or not to B.C.?

Ong Bak is out on DVD today. If you didn't see this movie in theatres, you NEED to run as fast as you can to your local video store and buy it. Don't be too hasty while purchasing it, though. You're never in too much of a rush to forget manners. After that, sprint home and watch the film. This is Tony Jaa's (North American) debut and he is, rightfully so, being heralded as the next Bruce Lee. The stunts he does in this movie will leave you in awe. All these stunts, performed by Jaa himself, are also done without the use of computer effects or wires. You may be thinking to yourself, "But Dan, what about plot? Isn't there a story?" To which my response is: plot? Listen son, in a movie like this, the plot exists for one reason, and the reason is this: To put the star in as many chase and fight scenes as possible, and to that end it succeeds. You'll forget all about your precious storyline when you see the Jaa man crackin' dozens of skulls with his knees and elbows. Or the part where he literally folds himself in half at full sprint to squeeze through a ring of barb wire just because he can. Or when he lights his feet on fire and leaves his enemies beaten and charred. Or when he runs up that one guy's back and runs over top of some hopeless goons' heads. I could go on all day. The bottom line is, if you like action movies and martial arts, this is the one to see.
I guess I missed the boat a bit on this, but who cares? It's not like anyone reads this. But just in case someone accidentally does, though, THIS SITE is great.

Oh man what I would have given to have been in CBGB's tonight.  Thankfully, since I couldn't be, there was at least a live feed from the club, and god dammit, Kid Dynamite were in-fucking-credible.  For a band that broke up, what.. 5 years ago?  They were nearly spot on.  I literally hurt for Jason as he just ravaged his vocal chords for a solid hour.  I was sitting on the edge of my seat watching, singing, whoa-whoaing, and fist-pumping for the whole set.  There are certain bands that just exude passion and it makes every song so much more amazing.  You can feel the heart and soul and sincerity in every chord, every drum fill, and every scream.  This is why I love music.  R.I.P. Kid Dynamite, one of the most inspiring and powerful bands I've ever listened to.

"Tell myself it's all right to be part of this life of aching hearts and good times. I never felt this was a crime. Down here. You can't tell me what to do Down here. You can't tell what to feel. You can't touch me. You can't see me. If you're lucky you'll hear me scream! Free myself from what lies in the burden of 9 to 5. I take the time to cherish the life and the memories that come with it I can't pretend that life's 0.K., bleeding the blood of conformity. I hear my angel sing her song of salvation and this is how it goes. Woah Woah Woah...GO!"
You know what I'd like to see before I die?  A 1:1 scale map of the world.  It saddens me that the odds of this happening are not what the bookie would call "a good bet".
I decided on my Halloween costume for this year.  Very excited.

So we all know that Wheaties is the supposed "Breakfast of Champions".  What I don't get is, where's everyone else's breakfast?  Not everyone's a champion, and no number of bowls of Wheaties are going to change that.  I think Wheaties, and cereal companies in general, are missing out on a huge market by not targeting these people.  For instance, why not "Breakfast of Runner-Ups"?  How about "Breakfast of Honrouable Mentions"?  "Breakfast of A for Efforts", or even "Breakfast of Dead Lasts".  "Breakfast of Losers" sounds a bit harsh, but that's a huge untapped demographic.  Don't stop there though.  "Breakfast of the Ones That Showed Up Late", "Breakfast of Couldn't Make it Out That Days", and "Breakfast of People That Didn't Give a Shit" could all be successful, the latter especially, I think.  Even more specific than that, why not "Breakfast of Arthritic Cripples", "Breakfast of Old Jaded Bastards" or "Breakfast of Relatives of Recently Deceased Who May Not Have Been Up To Running a Fuckin' Marathon on That Particular Morning".

Well, I just got back from seeing The Island. Pretty good flick, I must say, but man, do I ever feel like playing XBOX. Then, after that I think I'll need to cool off a bit (those games get pretty intense) so I'll relax and drink some Aquafina brand bottled water. While I'm enjoying my refreshing Aquafina I might just do an MSN Search and look up some fine Chrysler automobiles. Yes sir, that sounds like a plan. Also, I might get an exact replica made of myself in case I suddenly get diagnosed with liver disease or something.
"The robots will be nice then they will turn on you."

I guess, in retrospect, going to KFC for lunch was my first mistake. The second, and worst mistake, was not picking up on the subtle hint cleverly hidden in the name of the sandwich in question; The Snacker. This would not be suitable as toddler's appetizer before a main course of a jar of vaguely-flavoured muck let alone a lunch for a hulking behemoth like me. Here is a handy comparison I made to give you an idea of the size of The Snacker. The following picture is to scale. Don't buy The Snacker unless your normal meal is roughly the size of 1 (one) Canadian penny.
Happy Birthday Baby, hope you're ready for Andy, Steve and I to put the B back in BBQ.  The B that stands for Fun.

Good weekend, despite the ass weather. We got there Friday night sometime around 8:30 I think, and hung out with my Dad for a bit, shooting the crap and playing guitar. Well, him and Steve played guitar, Andy and I just made jokes and mock attempts at the ol' axe. After a few hours of that and a few brews, we called it a night and retired to the cottage. We all woke up fairly early on Saturday and decided to drive into Parry Sound for some breakfast and to visit Ben and Dominic. That was fun, Dominic was awesome as usual, and Ben was hungover as a sonofabitch. Oh, and there was a girl at Wendy's who looked pretty much exactly like April. After a while, we drove back to my Dad's place. It was cool and overcast, but that didn't stop Steve and I from jumping in the lake (albeit briefly). The water was fucking frigid, so I went in first and swam straight for the dock and got out. As I was walking, shivering, past Steve, I told him the water was nice, so just run and jump in. As he's running down the dock Andy asks how the water is. "God damn cold", I tell him, and he laughs, just as Steve is jumping off the end of the dock. Steve gets out of the water and makes a bee line for the cottage and says "I knew it was gonna be bad when I heard Andy laugh as I was jumping." Moral of the story? Tricking people is fun. The rest of the weekend wasn't too eventful.. we went for a little boat ride and went to the diving cliff, but I was the only one that jumped. Andy and Steve are a couple of Grade A Pussies, that much is clear now. Then neither of them were feeling well so they ditched out on the bonfire pretty early. I stayed for another hour or so, then went down to the cottage with them and chilled for a bit before bed. Sunday we just chilled for a bit and had breakfast/lunch, chilled for a bit more then said our goodbyes and farewells. Oh, and they didn't bring me a sombrero back from Mexico. OR tequila. What the fuck's up with that?

Streetlight was fucking intense.  Strong contender for best band I've ever seen live.. I loved how they segued each song into the next and even threw in a couple catch 22 songs.  No Bandits tunes though, but you can't win 'em all.  They still ruled.  Props to Steve for going and even getting into the pit, even after the vicious beating he received a few days earlier.  I hope they play here again before they break up.  I'm going to bed

11 days later...it's all gone I'm tired right now and my legs hurt. At least I can imagine how Steve's back and ribs feel, and it makes me feel better. Recap: last night Steve and I had a Herculean brawl on an epic scale worthy of mythological greek metaphors. It was gruelling and barbaric and, although I was the victor, Steve should have no shame in the loss. He fought hard and heroically, and should hold his head up high. As he walks down loser lane. IN YO FACE skeet skeet skeet

Against me! brought it like mad. So I guess it's time for THIS (see below) to go.. It was a good four weeks, though. We shared some laughs, and our time together will never be forgotten. For now, my friend, I bid you adieu.

So I'm back in Milton earlier today.  I am at a terminal just off of Thompson, running a jumper for a routine install.  Up walk two Entourage thugs who start going through the usual bullshit they talk about.  I try to hurry up because I just want to get out of there, then the guy in the silver pick-up from yesterday drives by on Thompson and I hear the guy yell "we're comin' to get ya".  At this point I start packing my shit up and closing the doors to the terminal, but the jumper wire is going from my bag to the terminal so I had to re-open the door and cut the wire.  I do that and start walking to the van as the guy makes a comment about me being done so soon.  As I get into the van, the silver pick-up comes around the corner and parks perpendicular to me, blocking the whole street, then turns to the side and reverses right in front of me, and I notice another truck pull up right behind me.  So now I'm blocked in.  Fuckin' great.  I look in the rear view and then up to the truck in front, and realize that with the two guys on foot there are seven guys in two vehicles surrounding me.  I lock the door and pick up the cell phone and call my manager.  I tell him what's going on and he says he's going to call back in a minute.  He hangs up, and one of the guys comes up and makes a motion for me to roll down the window, so I roll it down a bit and ask what he wants, and he says, "you don't know what this is about?"

"I know you guys have a problem with Bell, but I have nothing to do with that.  I'm just doing my job", I tell him.

He tells me it's nothing personal.  Then, I'm guessing because he saw me on the phone and probably assumed I was calling the cops, he tells me that they're not threatening me.

That just pushes me over the deep end.  I tell him like fuck I'm not being threatened.  

"There are seven of you surrounding me and blocking me in here.  That guy that fucking followed me around and made a gun motion at me yesterday just yelled 'We're comin to get you' at me.  How the fuck am I not being threatened?"

He doesn't really give me an answer, but goes and confers with the cunt that followed me around yesterday.  Then that guy comes up to the window and tells me that they're going to let me go, so I say OK and watch the guy walk up to his truck and pull up a few feet.  Then he gets out of the truck again and says "I suggest you go home".  I tell him I'll think about it, then him and a couple of the other guys walk right in front of my van.  I swear I've never been so tempted to run anyone over.  

"If you're going to let me go get the fuck out of the way", I yell at them and eventually they meander out of my way.

I'm less than a block away and my manager calls me back, telling me to call dispatch and tell them I can't complete the job because of picketers and to assign me a different one, and if anyone follows me, he gives me the number for the Halton Regional Police.  I thank him and tell him I'm going to go to Tim Horton's or somewhere else public to call in, and if they follow me there I'll call the cops.  

As I'm on the phone, I notice the silver pick-up is parked behind me again, so I pull away and turn onto Thompson, and he follows up to the lights, then gets beside me.  He gives me a death stare so I figure it's as good a time as any for a little mockery.  As he's staring me down I do the little gun motion with my hand.  

I'm definitely getting my ass kicked if I go back to Milton.  I'm seriously considering bringing a bat or something tomorrow.

I was sitting in the van, on the north-east corner of Thompson and Derry. The hold music that is usually reserved for elevators in retirement homes just looping endlessly. What is taking John so long? He said he was right around the corner. I hear an engine and glance in the rear-view mirror. A silver pick-up truck. "Not John", I thought to myself. Probably another picketer. I continue waiting on hold, occasionally glancing back to the silver pick-up. The guy, whoever he is, just sitting there. The next time I look in the mirror he's talking on the phone. I check the side mirror and notice that he's looking right at me in the same mirror. "Proxy, Janet speaking." I had tuned out the hold muzak and her voice broke the silence suddenly, startling me. I'd nearly forgot why I was calling in the first place, but then snap back to reality and ask her a series of questions regarding the phone line I was sent to repair. As I'm scribbling down the numbers she's reading to me, A van pulls up in front of me. John. I say thank you and hang up as John walks up to my van. He asks who's in the pick-up. I shrug. "He's just been sitting there for about 10 minutes" I tell him. "Probably a picketer. You find out the problem?" "Yeah, I'm at the wrong terminal. I just need to go up the road." "Alright", he says. "Just call me if you've got any other problems." I say OK and he goes back to his van, and pulls away from the side of the road. I check my mirror and pull a U-turn right into a red light. While I'm stopped I look back and see the silver pick-up pull away from the side and make a U-turn. He stops right behind me. The light turns green so I go through the intersection. He's following me. I periodically check the rear-view with the intervals between glances getting shorter and shorter. I miss my turn. Still following. I make a right onto Britannia. He makes a right onto Britannia. I come to a red light at Britannia and Ontario Street. I turn right, and he follows. Traffic is a little thicker on Ontario, plus there's the luxury of an extra lane. I use the lane to pass two cars in front of me and then I get back into the left lane. He's a couple cars back now, but I can still see him in the mirror, so I know he can still see me. We continue like this for a few blocks until Ontario ends at Steeles. I get into the left-hand turn lane and check my mirror, but can't see him. I check the passenger side mirror and spot him coming up beside me. He stops right beside me, and makes a gun with his hand and does the universal sign for "I'm going to shoot you" then swerves over to the right-hand turn lane and heads east. My prior trepidation suddenly turns into fury. You think you can intimidate me, you dickless son of a bitch? Get back on the phone and call your friends. I crank the wheel and push down on the gas, and the tires squawk and spin. The back end slides out so I crank the wheel to the left to straighten out. I watch the needle on the speedometer climb and the white lines on the street are going by faster and faster. The back of the silver pick-up is getting closer and closer. He's stopped at a red light. I switch lanes and slam on the brakes and squeal to a stop beside him. I put it in park and unbuckle my seat belt while I reach for the door handle with my other hand. I see a surprised look on his face when he looks over to see me reaching for his passenger door. He reaches for the lock but I've already started pulling it open. His demeanor calm again, he says "You don't know who you're fucking with, kid." About the time he finishes his sentence I reach into his cab with my knee on the passenger seat and with all my weight I slam my fist into his jaw. He's still got his seat belt on so I unbuckle it and grab the back of his head and slam it into the steering wheel. He reaches for the shifter and pushes it into first and peels off. Momentum and gravity do their things and I find myself holding onto the swinging passenger door with my feet dragging along the asphalt. I can feel the tendons and muscles inside my arm stretching. They're burning like hell while I hold on. I'm starting to lose my grip on the door handle and for the first time think that maybe I should have maybe thought this idea through a little better. No time for second-guessing now. My arms are burning and aching from holding onto the door the way I imagine Nolan Ryan's did after he pitched his last no-hitter. The truck swerves to the right and then violently to the left, and as the door swings back towards the cab I use my last bit of strength to pull myself up and into the cab. I grab onto the holy shit bar and get a foot on the floor. I'm met with a hard punch to the side of the head. And another. I feel myself start to fall back but out of instinct I slam the door shut to avoid falling out of the cab again. Another punch. This one connects with my jaw with quite a bit of force. I'm definitely wishing I'd developed the plan a little more thoroughly now. Before another fist connects I grab the steering wheel and pull it hard to the right. The truck starts to fish-tail and the back end slams into a stoplight and everything goes black. When I come to, I lift my forehead away from the dashboard and shake the broken glass off of my arms and lap. I rub my eyes and look to my left. What I see is an empty seat where there should be a person. I look ahead and see a train wreck of a man lying on the road. I can tell he doesn't want any more of this, so I open my door and step out of the cab and stretch. I walk west towards the sun which is setting, by the looks of it, at the end of the street. I get back to the van and go to open the door. I notice the keys locked inside and I curse my impulsiveness as I walk across to a payphone to call a taxi.
